title: Mission
text:
Mission & scientific drivers
This page mirrors the mission text of the main HYDRA-EO site, but focuses on small examples that illustrate why hybrid ML and radiative transfer models are needed to monitor crop multiple stressors.



Example


Stress vs. control simulations
Use ToolsRTM and SCOPEinR to simulate reflectance and SIF for control vs. stressed canopies (e.g. stomatal closure, pathogen infection, water deficit) and visualise spectral differences.




Link to EO


From traits to satellite bands
Show how changes in LAI, Cab or Cw propagate to Sentinel-2, PRISMA or EnMAP bands, linking biophysical traits to spaceborne observables.

title: Tools
text:
Software used in HYDRA-EO tutorials
This page summarises the core software tools and R packages used throughout the HYDRA-EO tutorials. These tools support radiative transfer modelling, energy balance simulations, and hybrid approaches for vegetation trait retrieval, disease detection, and ecosystem monitoring.




R · Radiative transfer


ToolsRTM
ToolsRTM is an R package developed within HYDRA-EO to support forward radiative transfer simulations at leaf and canopy level. It provides implementations and wrappers for widely used RTMs, enabling consistent simulation of reflectance and fluorescence across multiple sensors.
Main capabilities include PROSAIL-based canopy reflectance simulations, band convolution to satellite spectral response functions, and harmonisation across multispectral and hyperspectral platforms.

Forward simulations of PROSAIL, INFORM, SPART, and MARMIT
Sensor-specific band aggregation
Designed for teaching, prototyping, and research workflows

Repository:
https://gitlab.com/caminoccg/toolsrtm




R · Energy balance & SIF


SCOPEinR
SCOPEinR provides an R interface to the SCOPE model, allowing users to simulate canopy energy balance, photosynthesis, land surface temperature, and sun-induced fluorescence (SIF) in a reproducible and scriptable environment.
Within HYDRA-EO tutorials, SCOPEinR is used to link radiative transfer with physiological processes and flux-related variables, supporting the interpretation of hyperspectral and thermal observations.

Canopy energy balance and flux simulations
Temperature and SIF modelling
Integration with RTM-based and machine learning workflows

Repository:
https://gitlab.com/caminoccg/scopeinr

title: Overview
text:
Processing pipelines by data source
Pipelines are organised by data source and level of processing. Each pipeline folder in the repository should contain a README.md describing inputs, steps, outputs and links to scripts or notebooks.



UAV/airborne


UAV & airborne processing
Radiometric and geometric correction of UAV and airborne hyperspectral/thermal data, mosaicking, BRDF normalisation and co-registration with field plots. Output products include surface reflectance cubes, temperature maps and quality masks.




Satellite EO processing


Satellite EO processing
Sentinel-2, PRISMA and EnMAP workflows (e.g. Sen2Cor atmospheric correction, spectral resampling, tiling and time-series aggregation), harmonised across sites for crop-stressor analysis and EO upscaling.




RTM library & hybrid ML


Hybrid ML methods
PROSAIL / SCOPE forward simulations via ToolsRTM and SCOPEinR, LUT generation, plant trait retrieval, and hybrid ML models trained on combined RTM–EO features for stress detection

Processing pipelines by data source
This section documents key methodological blocks: radiative transfer configurations, trait retrieval strategies and disease scoring.



UAV-airborne processing


UAV & airborne processing
Radiometric and geometric correction of UAV and airborne hyperspectral and thermal data, including mosaicking, BRDF normalisation, and co-registration with field plots. Output products include surface reflectance cubes, temperature maps, and quality masks.




Satellite


Satellite EO processing
Sentinel-2, PRISMA, and EnMAP workflows (e.g. Sen2Cor atmospheric correction, spectral resampling, tiling, and time-series aggregation), harmonised across sites for crop-stressor analysis and EO upscaling.




RTM-ML


RTM library & hybrid ML
PROSAIL and SCOPE forward simulations via ToolsRTM and SCOPEinR, LUT generation, plant trait retrieval, and hybrid ML models trained on combined RTM–EO features for crop stress detection.

This section summarises the HYDRA-EO work packages (WPs), outlining their scope, role, and position within the overall project timeline. Each work package contributes a specific set of activities—ranging from scientific requirements and data collection to modelling, integration, and dissemination—together forming a coherent end-to-end workflow.



WP1


Scientific requirement consolidation
Definition of scientific objectives, use cases, trait–stressor matrix, and alignment with ESA requirements and parallel EU initiatives.




WP2


Dataset collection
Field campaigns, UAV and airborne acquisitions, in-situ measurements, and harmonised dataset documentation across crops and sites.




WP3


Model development & validation
Development and validation of RTMs and EO-based models, including spectral sensitivity and sensor intercomparison.




WP4


Experimental dataset generation
Generation of experimental EO products, synthetic datasets, and stress-specific simulation libraries.




WP5


Earth system science exploitation
Analysis of functional traits, stress dynamics, and scaling from UAV to satellite EO products.




WP6


Societal relevance & transfer
Demonstration of applicability for agriculture, disease monitoring, and resilience, including stakeholder-oriented outputs.




WP7


Scientific roadmap
Identification of knowledge gaps and recommendations for future EO missions (CHIME, FLEX, LSTM).




WP8


Scientific collaboration
Coordination with ESA activities and relevant Horizon Europe projects.




WP9


Promotion & dissemination
Scientific communication, training material, workshops, and outreach activities.




WP10


Project management
Overall coordination, reporting, risk management, and contractual compliance.
